\u0627\u0644\u062d\u0641\u0627\u0638 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u062e\u0627\u0635\u062a\u0643 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0631\u064a\u0647\u0629

\u0641\u064a \u062d\u064a\u0646 \u0623\u0646 \u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0625\u062c\u0631\u0627\u0621 \u0644\u064a\u0633 \u0645\u0637\u0644\u0648\u0628\u0627\u060c \u0625\u0644\u0627 \u0623\u0646 \u0647\u0646\u0627\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0644\u064a\u0644 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u0634\u064a\u0627\u0621 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u064a \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u0642\u064a\u0627\u0645 \u0628\u0647\u0627 \u0644\u0644\u062d\u0641\u0627\u0638 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u062e\u0627\u0635\u062a\u0643 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0631\u064a\u0647\u0629:

  • \u0636\u0639 \u062f\u0627\u062e\u0644 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0623\u0633\u0641\u0644 \u0628\u0637\u0627\u0646\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633 \u0627\u0644\u0648\u0631\u0642\u064a\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0639\u062a\u0645\u062f\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0642\u0628\u0644 BPI \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f. \u0625\u0630\u0627 \u0644\u0645 \u064a\u0643\u0646 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0643 \u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633\u060c \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646\u0643 \u0648\u0636\u0639 \u0623\u0648\u0631\u0627\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0634\u062c\u0631 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0627\u0641\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0635\u0646\u0627\u062f\u064a\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0628\u064a\u062a\u0632\u0627 \u0623\u0648 \u0648\u0631\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0631\u0627\u0626\u062f \u062f\u0627\u062e\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0632\u0621 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0641\u0644\u064a \u0645\u0646 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643. \u0633\u064a\u0633\u0627\u0639\u062f \u0623\u064a\u0636\u0627 \u0631\u0634 \u0628\u064a\u0643\u0631\u0628\u0648\u0646\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0648\u062f\u0627 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0639 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0637\u0631\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0631\u064a\u0647\u0629.
  • \u0627\u062d\u062a\u0641\u0638 \u0628\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u062e\u0627\u0635\u062a\u0643 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0638\u0644 \u0625\u0646 \u0623\u0645\u0643\u0646\u060c \u0648\u0627\u062d\u0631\u0635 \u062f\u0627\u0626\u0645\u0627 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0625\u063a\u0644\u0627\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u063a\u0637\u0627\u0621 \u0644\u0639\u062f\u0645 \u0627\u0646\u062a\u0634\u0627\u0631 \u0623\u064a \u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0648\u0625\u0628\u0639\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062d\u0634\u0631\u0627\u062a \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062d\u064a\u0648\u0627\u0646\u0627\u062a \u0639\u0646 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643.

\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f\u061f

\u0639\u0646\u062f \u062f\u0641\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u0641\u064a \u0645\u0643\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a\u060c \u0641\u0625\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0644\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0643\u0645\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0637\u0628\u064a\u0639\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0641\u064a \u0643\u0648\u0645\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f. \u0641\u0628\u062f\u0644\u0627 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0630\u0647\u0627\u0628 \u0628\u0647\u0627 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0645\u0643\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a \u062d\u064a\u062b \u0642\u062f \u062a\u0637\u0644\u0642 \u063a\u0627\u0632 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u064a\u062b\u0627\u0646 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u063a\u0644\u0627\u0641 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0648\u064a\u060c \u062a\u0624\u062e\u0630 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0636\u0648\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0636\u0648\u0639\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0646\u0634\u0623\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062d\u0644\u064a\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f\u060c \u062d\u064a\u062b \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0647\u0646\u0627\u0643 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f. \u064a\u0633\u0627\u0639\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0627\u062d\u062a\u0641\u0627\u0638 \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0621 \u0648\u062a\u062e\u0635\u064a\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0631\u0648\u062c \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062d\u062f\u0627\u0626\u0642 \u062f\u0648\u0646 \u0627\u0633\u062a\u062e\u062f\u0627\u0645 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0643\u064a\u0645\u064a\u0627\u0626\u064a\u0629.

\u0648\u0641\u0651\u0631 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0644 \u0645\u0639 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621

\u0633\u064a\u0643\u0648\u0646 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0643 \u0623\u0642\u0644 \u0633\u0644\u0629 \u0642\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u062d\u062c\u0645\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062e\u0644\u0635 \u0645\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0643\u0644 \u0623\u0633\u0628\u0648\u0639 \u0628\u0639\u062f \u0648\u0636\u0639 \u0641\u0636\u0644\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0637\u0639\u0627\u0645 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0648\u0631\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062a\u0633\u062e \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0637\u0639\u0627\u0645 \u0641\u064a \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621. \u0648\u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0642\u062f \u064a\u0633\u0645\u062d \u0644\u0643 \u0628\u062a\u0635\u063a\u064a\u0631 \u062d\u062c\u0645 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u062d\u062c\u0645 \u0623\u0635\u063a\u0631 \u0648\u0628\u0623\u0642\u0644 \u062a\u0643\u0644\u0641\u0629. \u062a\u0648\u0641\u0631 Austin Resource Recovery \u0623\u0631\u0628\u0639\u0629 \u0623\u062d\u062c\u0627\u0645 \u0644\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a - \u0641\u0623\u0635\u063a\u0631 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629\u060c \u062a\u0643\u0644\u0641\u062a\u0647\u0627 \u0623\u0642\u0644.

", "additional_content_en": "

Keeping your compost cart fresh

While it is not required, there are a few things you can do to keep your compost cart from smelling bad:

  • Line your compost cart with a paper bag or use BPI-certified compostable bags. If you don\u2019t have a bag, you can put dry leaves, pizza boxes, or newspaper on the bottom of your cart. Sprinkling baking soda on the bottom will also help keep the smell down.
  • Keep your compost cart in the shade if possible, and always keep the lid closed to contain the smell and to keep bugs and animals out of your cart.

Why compost?

When buried in a landfill, compostable materials do not break down as they would in nature or in a compost pile. Instead of going to a landfill, where they would release methane into the atmosphere, organic materials placed in the green carts are taken to a local composting facility, where they break down into compost. Compost helps soil retain water and fertilizes lawns and gardens without using chemicals.

Save money with your green cart

You will have less trash to throw away each week after putting food scraps and food-soiled paper in your green cart. This may allow you to downsize to a smaller, less expensive trash cart. Austin Resource Recovery offers four trash cart sizes \u2013 the smaller the cart, the less it costs each month.

", "additional_content_es": "

C\u00f3mo mantener su bote de compost fresco

Aunque no es necesario, estas son algunas cosas que puede hacer para evitar que su bote de compostaje huela mal:

  • Coloque una bolsa de papel dentro del bote de compostaje o use bolsas de compostaje certificadas por BPI. Si no tiene una bolsa, puede colocar hojas secas, cajas de pizza o peri\u00f3dico en el fondo del bote. Espolvorear bicarbonato de soda en el fondo del bote tambi\u00e9n controlar\u00e1 el olor.
  • Mantenga su bote de compostaje en la sombra si es posible y siempre cerrado para contener el olor y evitar que le entren insectos y animales.

\u00bfPor qu\u00e9 es bueno hacer compost?

Cuando se entierran en un vertedero de basura, los materiales para compostaje no se descomponen como lo har\u00edan en la naturaleza o en una pila de compost. En lugar de ir al vertedero, donde expulsar\u00edan gas metano a la atm\u00f3sfera, los materiales org\u00e1nicos colocados en los botes verdes son llevados al centro de compostaje local donde se descomponen para formar compost. El compost ayuda a la tierra a retener el agua y sirve como fertilizante para el c\u00e9sped y jardines sin necesidad de qu\u00edmicos.

\u00a1El bote verde le ahorra dinero!

Despu\u00e9s de poner los restos de comida y los papeles que se hayan ensuciado con alimentos en su bote verde, tendr\u00e1 menos basura que tirar cada semana. Esto podr\u00eda permitirle cambiarse a un bote de basura m\u00e1s peque\u00f1o y m\u00e1s barato. Austin Resource Recovery ofrece cuatro tama\u00f1os de botes de basura y, mientras m\u00e1s peque\u00f1o, menos le cuesta al mes.

", "additional_content_vi": "

Gi\u1eef thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh t\u01b0\u01a1i s\u1ea1ch:

Cho d\u00f9 kh\u00f4ng b\u1eaft bu\u1ed9c, v\u1eabn c\u00f3 m\u1ed9t s\u1ed1 \u0111i\u1ec1u qu\u00fd v\u1ecb c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 l\u00e0m \u0111\u1ec3 gi\u1eef cho th\u00f9ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh kh\u00f4ng b\u1ecb b\u1ed1c m\u00f9i kh\u00f3 ch\u1ecbu:

  • L\u00f3t th\u00f9ng \u0111\u1ef1ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 b\u1eb1ng t\u00fai gi\u1ea5y ho\u1eb7c d\u00f9ng t\u00fai c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y v\u00e0 \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c ch\u1ee9ng nh\u1eadn b\u1edfi BPI. N\u1ebfu qu\u00fd v\u1ecb kh\u00f4ng c\u00f3 t\u00fai, qu\u00fd v\u1ecb c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 l\u00f3t \u0111\u00e1y th\u00f9ng b\u1eb1ng l\u00e1 kh\u00f4, h\u1ed9p pizza, ho\u1eb7c gi\u1ea5y b\u00e1o. R\u1eafc thu\u1ed1c mu\u1ed1i \u1edf d\u01b0\u1edbi \u0111\u00e1y c\u0169ng s\u1ebd gi\u00fap gi\u1ea3m b\u1ed1c m\u00f9i.
  • N\u1ebfu c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 h\u00e3y \u0111\u1ec3 th\u00f9ng r\u00e1c \u0111\u1ef1ng ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1 d\u01b0\u1edbi b\u00f3ng m\u00e1t, v\u00e0 lu\u00f4n \u0111\u1eady n\u1eafp k\u00edn \u0111\u1ec3 gi\u1eef m\u00f9i h\u00f4i v\u00e0 khi\u1ebfn cho c\u00e1c lo\u1ea1i s\u00e2u b\u1ecd c\u0169ng nh\u01b0 th\u00fa v\u1eadt kh\u00f4ng v\u00e0o th\u00f9ng c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh.

T\u1ea1i sao l\u1ea1i \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1?

Khi b\u1ecb ch\u00f4n \u1edf m\u1ed9t b\u00e3i ch\u00f4n r\u00e1c, c\u00e1c ch\u1ea5t khi th\u01b0\u1eddng th\u00ec t\u1ef1 ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y s\u1ebd kh\u00f4ng tan r\u00e3 nh\u01b0 khi ch\u00fang \u1edf trong thi\u00ean nhi\u00ean ho\u1eb7c \u1edf trong m\u1ed9t \u0111\u1ed1ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1. Thay v\u00ec cho ra b\u00e3i ch\u00f4n r\u00e1c, n\u01a1i m\u00e0 ch\u00fang s\u1ebd th\u1ea3i kh\u00ed m\u00ea-than (methanol) v\u00e0o trong kh\u00f4ng kh\u00ed, c\u00e1c v\u1eadt li\u1ec7u h\u1eefu c\u01a1 n\u00e0y \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c \u0111\u1eb7t trong c\u00e1c th\u00f9ng xe r\u00e1c m\u00e0u xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y \u0111\u1ec3 \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c \u0111\u01b0a \u0111\u1ebfn m\u1ed9t c\u01a1 s\u1edf \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 \u1edf \u0111\u1ecba ph\u01b0\u01a1ng, \u1edf \u0111\u00f3 ch\u00fang ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y th\u00e0nh ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1. Ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1 gi\u00fap cho \u0111\u1ea5t gi\u1eef d\u01b0\u1ee3c n\u01b0\u1edbc v\u00e0 l\u00e0m ph\u00e2n b\u00f3n cho b\u00e3i c\u1ecf v\u00e0 v\u01b0\u1eddn t\u01b0\u1ee3c m\u00e0 kh\u00f4ng ph\u1ea3i s\u1eed d\u1ee5ng h\u00f3a ch\u1ea5t.

Ti\u1ebft ki\u1ec7m ti\u1ec1n v\u1edbi thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y

Qu\u00fd v\u1ecb s\u1ebd c\u00f3 \u00edt \u0111i s\u1ed1 r\u00e1c ph\u1ea3i v\u1ee9t b\u1ecf m\u1ed7i tu\u1ea7n sau khi cho c\u00e1c \u0111\u1ed3 \u0103n th\u1eeba v\u00e0 gi\u1ea5y b\u1ecdc th\u1ef1c ph\u1ea9m \u0111\u00e3 b\u1ea9n v\u00e0o trong th\u00f9ng xe r\u00e1c m\u00e0u xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh. \u0110i\u1ec1u n\u00e0y c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 cho ph\u00e9p qu\u00fd v\u1ecb gi\u1ea3m k\u00edch th\u01b0\u1edbc thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c xu\u1ed1ng lo\u1ea1i nh\u1ecf h\u01a1n, \u0111\u1ee1 t\u1ed1n k\u00e9m h\u01a1n. S\u1edf Ph\u1ee5c H\u1ed3i Ngu\u1ed3n L\u1ef1c Austin cung c\u1ea5p b\u1ed1n c\u1ee1 thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c \u2013 xe nh\u1ecf h\u01a1n, th\u00ec chi ph\u00ed \u00edt h\u01a1n m\u1ed7i th\u00e1ng.

Keeping your compost cart fresh

While it is not required, there are a few things you can do to keep your compost cart from smelling bad:

  • Line your compost cart with a paper bag or use BPI-certified compostable bags. If you don\u2019t have a bag, you can put dry leaves, pizza boxes, or newspaper on the bottom of your cart. Sprinkling baking soda on the bottom will also help keep the smell down.
  • Keep your compost cart in the shade if possible, and always keep the lid closed to contain the smell and to keep bugs and animals out of your cart.

Why compost?

When buried in a landfill, compostable materials do not break down as they would in nature or in a compost pile. Instead of going to a landfill, where they would release methane into the atmosphere, organic materials placed in the green carts are taken to a local composting facility, where they break down into compost. Compost helps soil retain water and fertilizes lawns and gardens without using chemicals.

Save money with your green cart

You will have less trash to throw away each week after putting food scraps and food-soiled paper in your green cart. This may allow you to downsize to a smaller, less expensive trash cart. Austin Resource Recovery offers four trash cart sizes \u2013 the smaller the cart, the less it costs each month.

  • \u0636\u0639 \u062f\u0627\u062e\u0644 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0623\u0633\u0641\u0644 \u0628\u0637\u0627\u0646\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633 \u0627\u0644\u0648\u0631\u0642\u064a\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0627\u0644\u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0639\u062a\u0645\u062f\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0642\u0628\u0644 BPI \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f. \u0625\u0630\u0627 \u0644\u0645 \u064a\u0643\u0646 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0643 \u0623\u0643\u064a\u0627\u0633\u060c \u064a\u0645\u0643\u0646\u0643 \u0648\u0636\u0639 \u0623\u0648\u0631\u0627\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0634\u062c\u0631 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0627\u0641\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0635\u0646\u0627\u062f\u064a\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0628\u064a\u062a\u0632\u0627 \u0623\u0648 \u0648\u0631\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0631\u0627\u0626\u062f \u062f\u0627\u062e\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0632\u0621 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0641\u0644\u064a \u0645\u0646 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643. \u0633\u064a\u0633\u0627\u0639\u062f \u0623\u064a\u0636\u0627 \u0631\u0634 \u0628\u064a\u0643\u0631\u0628\u0648\u0646\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0635\u0648\u062f\u0627 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0639 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0637\u0631\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0627\u0644\u0643\u0631\u064a\u0647\u0629.
  • \u0627\u062d\u062a\u0641\u0638 \u0628\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u062e\u0627\u0635\u062a\u0643 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0638\u0644 \u0625\u0646 \u0623\u0645\u0643\u0646\u060c \u0648\u0627\u062d\u0631\u0635 \u062f\u0627\u0626\u0645\u0627 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0625\u063a\u0644\u0627\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u063a\u0637\u0627\u0621 \u0644\u0639\u062f\u0645 \u0627\u0646\u062a\u0634\u0627\u0631 \u0623\u064a \u0631\u0648\u0627\u0626\u062d \u0648\u0625\u0628\u0639\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062d\u0634\u0631\u0627\u062a \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062d\u064a\u0648\u0627\u0646\u0627\u062a \u0639\u0646 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643.

\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f\u061f

\u0639\u0646\u062f \u062f\u0641\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0627\u0628\u0644\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f \u0641\u064a \u0645\u0643\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a\u060c \u0641\u0625\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0644\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0643\u0645\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0637\u0628\u064a\u0639\u0629 \u0623\u0648 \u0641\u064a \u0643\u0648\u0645\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f. \u0641\u0628\u062f\u0644\u0627 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0630\u0647\u0627\u0628 \u0628\u0647\u0627 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0645\u0643\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a \u062d\u064a\u062b \u0642\u062f \u062a\u0637\u0644\u0642 \u063a\u0627\u0632 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u064a\u062b\u0627\u0646 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u063a\u0644\u0627\u0641 \u0627\u0644\u062c\u0648\u064a\u060c \u062a\u0624\u062e\u0630 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0636\u0648\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0636\u0648\u0639\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0627\u0644\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0646\u0634\u0623\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062d\u0644\u064a\u0629 \u0644\u0644\u062a\u0633\u0645\u064a\u062f\u060c \u062d\u064a\u062b \u062a\u062a\u062d\u0644\u0644 \u0647\u0646\u0627\u0643 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f. \u064a\u0633\u0627\u0639\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0633\u0645\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u062a\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0627\u062d\u062a\u0641\u0627\u0638 \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0621 \u0648\u062a\u062e\u0635\u064a\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0631\u0648\u062c \u0648\u0627\u0644\u062d\u062f\u0627\u0626\u0642 \u062f\u0648\u0646 \u0627\u0633\u062a\u062e\u062f\u0627\u0645 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0648\u0627\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0643\u064a\u0645\u064a\u0627\u0626\u064a\u0629.

\u0648\u0641\u0651\u0631 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0627\u0644 \u0645\u0639 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621

\u0633\u064a\u0643\u0648\u0646 \u0644\u062f\u064a\u0643 \u0623\u0642\u0644 \u0633\u0644\u0629 \u0642\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u062d\u062c\u0645\u0627 \u062a\u062a\u062e\u0644\u0635 \u0645\u0646\u0647\u0627 \u0643\u0644 \u0623\u0633\u0628\u0648\u0639 \u0628\u0639\u062f \u0648\u0636\u0639 \u0641\u0636\u0644\u0627\u062a \u0627\u0644\u0637\u0639\u0627\u0645 \u0648\u0627\u0644\u0648\u0631\u0642 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u062a\u0633\u062e \u0628\u0627\u0644\u0637\u0639\u0627\u0645 \u0641\u064a \u0639\u0631\u0628\u062a\u0643 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0636\u0631\u0627\u0621. \u0648\u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0642\u062f \u064a\u0633\u0645\u062d \u0644\u0643 \u0628\u062a\u0635\u063a\u064a\u0631 \u062d\u062c\u0645 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0642\u0645\u0627\u0645\u0629 \u0625\u0644\u0649 \u062d\u062c\u0645 \u0623\u0635\u063a\u0631 \u0648\u0628\u0623\u0642\u0644 \u062a\u0643\u0644\u0641\u0629. \u062a\u0648\u0641\u0631 Austin Resource Recovery \u0623\u0631\u0628\u0639\u0629 \u0623\u062d\u062c\u0627\u0645 \u0644\u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629 \u0627\u0644\u0646\u0641\u0627\u064a\u0627\u062a - \u0641\u0623\u0635\u063a\u0631 \u0639\u0631\u0628\u0629\u060c \u062a\u0643\u0644\u0641\u062a\u0647\u0627 \u0623\u0642\u0644.

Keeping your compost cart fresh

While it is not required, there are a few things you can do to keep your compost cart from smelling bad:

  • Line your compost cart with a paper bag or use BPI-certified compostable bags. If you don\u2019t have a bag, you can put dry leaves, pizza boxes, or newspaper on the bottom of your cart. Sprinkling baking soda on the bottom will also help keep the smell down.
  • Keep your compost cart in the shade if possible, and always keep the lid closed to contain the smell and to keep bugs and animals out of your cart.

Why compost?

When buried in a landfill, compostable materials do not break down as they would in nature or in a compost pile. Instead of going to a landfill, where they would release methane into the atmosphere, organic materials placed in the green carts are taken to a local composting facility, where they break down into compost. Compost helps soil retain water and fertilizes lawns and gardens without using chemicals.

Save money with your green cart

You will have less trash to throw away each week after putting food scraps and food-soiled paper in your green cart. This may allow you to downsize to a smaller, less expensive trash cart. Austin Resource Recovery offers four trash cart sizes \u2013 the smaller the cart, the less it costs each month.

", "additional_content_es": "

C\u00f3mo mantener su bote de compost fresco

Aunque no es necesario, estas son algunas cosas que puede hacer para evitar que su bote de compostaje huela mal:

  • Coloque una bolsa de papel dentro del bote de compostaje o use bolsas de compostaje certificadas por BPI. Si no tiene una bolsa, puede colocar hojas secas, cajas de pizza o peri\u00f3dico en el fondo del bote. Espolvorear bicarbonato de soda en el fondo del bote tambi\u00e9n controlar\u00e1 el olor.
  • Mantenga su bote de compostaje en la sombra si es posible y siempre cerrado para contener el olor y evitar que le entren insectos y animales.

\u00bfPor qu\u00e9 es bueno hacer compost?

Cuando se entierran en un vertedero de basura, los materiales para compostaje no se descomponen como lo har\u00edan en la naturaleza o en una pila de compost. En lugar de ir al vertedero, donde expulsar\u00edan gas metano a la atm\u00f3sfera, los materiales org\u00e1nicos colocados en los botes verdes son llevados al centro de compostaje local donde se descomponen para formar compost. El compost ayuda a la tierra a retener el agua y sirve como fertilizante para el c\u00e9sped y jardines sin necesidad de qu\u00edmicos.

\u00a1El bote verde le ahorra dinero!

Despu\u00e9s de poner los restos de comida y los papeles que se hayan ensuciado con alimentos en su bote verde, tendr\u00e1 menos basura que tirar cada semana. Esto podr\u00eda permitirle cambiarse a un bote de basura m\u00e1s peque\u00f1o y m\u00e1s barato. Austin Resource Recovery ofrece cuatro tama\u00f1os de botes de basura y, mientras m\u00e1s peque\u00f1o, menos le cuesta al mes.

", "additional_content_vi": "

Gi\u1eef thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh t\u01b0\u01a1i s\u1ea1ch:

Cho d\u00f9 kh\u00f4ng b\u1eaft bu\u1ed9c, v\u1eabn c\u00f3 m\u1ed9t s\u1ed1 \u0111i\u1ec1u qu\u00fd v\u1ecb c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 l\u00e0m \u0111\u1ec3 gi\u1eef cho th\u00f9ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh kh\u00f4ng b\u1ecb b\u1ed1c m\u00f9i kh\u00f3 ch\u1ecbu:

  • L\u00f3t th\u00f9ng \u0111\u1ef1ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 b\u1eb1ng t\u00fai gi\u1ea5y ho\u1eb7c d\u00f9ng t\u00fai c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y v\u00e0 \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c ch\u1ee9ng nh\u1eadn b\u1edfi BPI. N\u1ebfu qu\u00fd v\u1ecb kh\u00f4ng c\u00f3 t\u00fai, qu\u00fd v\u1ecb c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 l\u00f3t \u0111\u00e1y th\u00f9ng b\u1eb1ng l\u00e1 kh\u00f4, h\u1ed9p pizza, ho\u1eb7c gi\u1ea5y b\u00e1o. R\u1eafc thu\u1ed1c mu\u1ed1i \u1edf d\u01b0\u1edbi \u0111\u00e1y c\u0169ng s\u1ebd gi\u00fap gi\u1ea3m b\u1ed1c m\u00f9i.
  • N\u1ebfu c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 h\u00e3y \u0111\u1ec3 th\u00f9ng r\u00e1c \u0111\u1ef1ng ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1 d\u01b0\u1edbi b\u00f3ng m\u00e1t, v\u00e0 lu\u00f4n \u0111\u1eady n\u1eafp k\u00edn \u0111\u1ec3 gi\u1eef m\u00f9i h\u00f4i v\u00e0 khi\u1ebfn cho c\u00e1c lo\u1ea1i s\u00e2u b\u1ecd c\u0169ng nh\u01b0 th\u00fa v\u1eadt kh\u00f4ng v\u00e0o th\u00f9ng c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh.

T\u1ea1i sao l\u1ea1i \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1?

Khi b\u1ecb ch\u00f4n \u1edf m\u1ed9t b\u00e3i ch\u00f4n r\u00e1c, c\u00e1c ch\u1ea5t khi th\u01b0\u1eddng th\u00ec t\u1ef1 ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y s\u1ebd kh\u00f4ng tan r\u00e3 nh\u01b0 khi ch\u00fang \u1edf trong thi\u00ean nhi\u00ean ho\u1eb7c \u1edf trong m\u1ed9t \u0111\u1ed1ng r\u00e1c \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1. Thay v\u00ec cho ra b\u00e3i ch\u00f4n r\u00e1c, n\u01a1i m\u00e0 ch\u00fang s\u1ebd th\u1ea3i kh\u00ed m\u00ea-than (methanol) v\u00e0o trong kh\u00f4ng kh\u00ed, c\u00e1c v\u1eadt li\u1ec7u h\u1eefu c\u01a1 n\u00e0y \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c \u0111\u1eb7t trong c\u00e1c th\u00f9ng xe r\u00e1c m\u00e0u xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y \u0111\u1ec3 \u0111\u01b0\u1ee3c \u0111\u01b0a \u0111\u1ebfn m\u1ed9t c\u01a1 s\u1edf \u1ee7 ph\u00e2n h\u1eefu c\u01a1 \u1edf \u0111\u1ecba ph\u01b0\u01a1ng, \u1edf \u0111\u00f3 ch\u00fang ph\u00e2n h\u1ee7y th\u00e0nh ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1. Ph\u00e2n \u1ee7 h\u1eefu c\u01a1 gi\u00fap cho \u0111\u1ea5t gi\u1eef d\u01b0\u1ee3c n\u01b0\u1edbc v\u00e0 l\u00e0m ph\u00e2n b\u00f3n cho b\u00e3i c\u1ecf v\u00e0 v\u01b0\u1eddn t\u01b0\u1ee3c m\u00e0 kh\u00f4ng ph\u1ea3i s\u1eed d\u1ee5ng h\u00f3a ch\u1ea5t.

Ti\u1ebft ki\u1ec7m ti\u1ec1n v\u1edbi thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y

Qu\u00fd v\u1ecb s\u1ebd c\u00f3 \u00edt \u0111i s\u1ed1 r\u00e1c ph\u1ea3i v\u1ee9t b\u1ecf m\u1ed7i tu\u1ea7n sau khi cho c\u00e1c \u0111\u1ed3 \u0103n th\u1eeba v\u00e0 gi\u1ea5y b\u1ecdc th\u1ef1c ph\u1ea9m \u0111\u00e3 b\u1ea9n v\u00e0o trong th\u00f9ng xe r\u00e1c m\u00e0u xanh l\u00e1 c\u00e2y c\u1ee7a m\u00ecnh. \u0110i\u1ec1u n\u00e0y c\u00f3 th\u1ec3 cho ph\u00e9p qu\u00fd v\u1ecb gi\u1ea3m k\u00edch th\u01b0\u1edbc thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c xu\u1ed1ng lo\u1ea1i nh\u1ecf h\u01a1n, \u0111\u1ee1 t\u1ed1n k\u00e9m h\u01a1n. S\u1edf Ph\u1ee5c H\u1ed3i Ngu\u1ed3n L\u1ef1c Austin cung c\u1ea5p b\u1ed1n c\u1ee1 thu\u0300ng xe ra\u0301c \u2013 xe nh\u1ecf h\u01a1n, th\u00ec chi ph\u00ed \u00edt h\u01a1n m\u1ed7i th\u00e1ng.

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

{"pk": 28, "path": "00010001000M", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "How we store and use your data", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "How we store and use your data", "title_es": "C\u00f3mo almacenamos y usamos su informaci\u00f3n", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "How we store and use your data", "slug": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_ar": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_en": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_es": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_vi": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T22:48:29.187Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:48:29.147Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-20T22:50:20.991Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": false, "description": "", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly. You can see previous trend reports and recommendations here. [link when available]

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly. You can see previous trend reports and recommendations here. [link when available]

", "additional_content_es": "

Cuando usted presenta una queja contra un oficial del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin, cualquier informaci\u00f3n que comparta ser\u00e1 confidencial, al menos y hasta que algo lo haga p\u00fablico. Esto puede incluir el hecho de que el caso pase a un tribunal criminal, lo que significa que puede estar sujeto a descubrimiento de pruebas. En esos casos, redactamos cualquier informaci\u00f3n de contacto que fue suministrada, pero no los nombres.

Su queja se le env\u00eda por correo electr\u00f3nico autom\u00e1ticamente a usted y a la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda y se almacena en un servidor de Microsoft Exchange. Luego el personal en la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda la revisa, la introduce manualmente a la base de datos que se comparte con Asuntos Internos, una divisi\u00f3n del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Para prop\u00f3sitos de reporte y an\u00e1lisis de tendencias, introducimos las quejas de manera an\u00f3nima en una base de datos Sharepoint por separado.

Tambi\u00e9n utilizamos su informaci\u00f3n para encontrar tendencias y patrones en las quejas y agradecimientos, y de esta manera proponemos recomendaciones para las pol\u00edticas y entrenamientos del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Usted puede ver los reportes y recomendaciones anteriores aqu\u00ed. [link when available]

", "additional_content_vi": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly. You can see previous trend reports and recommendations here. [link when available]

", "additional_content_ar": "

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_es": "Proceso de Investigaci\u00f3n de Quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.551Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:20.697Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

After you file a complaint, it will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs and overseen by OPO.

  1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

  1. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

  1. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs. The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.SustainedThe evidence supports the allegation.ExoneratedThe evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.UnfoundedThe evidence does not support the allegation.InconclusiveThe evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).Administratively ClosedAll of the following are true:(a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.(b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.(c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

  1. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

After you file a complaint, it will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs and overseen by OPO.

  1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

  1. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

  1. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs. The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.SustainedThe evidence supports the allegation.ExoneratedThe evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.UnfoundedThe evidence does not support the allegation.InconclusiveThe evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).Administratively ClosedAll of the following are true:(a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.(b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.(c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

  1. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

", "additional_content_es": "

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

  1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

  1. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

  1. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias. La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.AceptadaLa evidencia apoya el alegato.ExoneradaLa evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.InfundadaLa evidencia no apoya el alegato.InconclusaLa evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).Cerrada administrativamenteTodos los siguientes aplican:(a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.(b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.(c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado.Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

  1. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un traductor si solicita uno.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

", "additional_content_vi": "

  1. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs. The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.SustainedThe evidence supports the allegation.ExoneratedThe evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.UnfoundedThe evidence does not support the allegation.InconclusiveThe evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).Administratively ClosedAll of the following are true:(a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.(b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.(c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

  1. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

", "additional_content_es": "

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

  1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

  1. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

  1. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias. La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.AceptadaLa evidencia apoya el alegato.ExoneradaLa evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.InfundadaLa evidencia no apoya el alegato.InconclusaLa evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).Cerrada administrativamenteTodos los siguientes aplican:(a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.(b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.(c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado.Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

  1. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un traductor si solicita uno.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

", "additional_content_vi": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 31, "path": "00010001000P", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Learn how to prevent crypto and other waterborne diseases", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Learn how to prevent crypto and other waterborne diseases", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": " Learn how to prevent crypto and other waterborne diseases", "slug": "learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases/", "url_path_ar": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases/", "url_path_en": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases/", "url_path_es": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases/", "url_path_vi": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-crypto-and-other-waterborne-diseases/", "owner": 2, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T23:21:33.168Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-02-20T23:21:33.090Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-20T23:25:15.086Z", "topic": 14, "toplink": false, "description": "In Austin, crypto is often spread through recreational water use.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "In Austin, crypto is often spread through recreational water use.", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

What is crypto?

Cryptosporidiosis, known as \u201ccrypto\u201d for short, is a contagious disease that causes diarrhea. The microscopic parasite that causes crypto often spreads through contaminated water.

Crypto in Austin

In Austin, cases of crypto increase during the summer. Crypto can spread through recreational water use in pools, hot tubs, water parks, and natural swimming holes like Barton Springs.

How to prevent crypto

Good hygiene is the best way to prevent crypto. Crypto is persistent! Even boiling water, chlorinating swimming pools, and using alcohol-based sanitizers won\u2019t kill it. To prevent the spread of crypto:

  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water.
  • Avoid alcohol-based hand gels and sanitizers.
  • Don\u2019t swallow water while swimming.
  • Avoid food that might be contaminated.
  • Disinfect all surfaces and objects that people who have crypto may have used.
  • If you have crypto, don\u2019t swim in recreational water while infected and for at least two weeks after diarrhea stops.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on crypto

{"pk": 32, "path": "00010001000Q", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Learn how to prevent the flu", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Learn how to prevent the flu", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": " Learn how to prevent the flu", "slug": "learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu/", "url_path_ar": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu/", "url_path_en": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu/", "url_path_es": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu/", "url_path_vi": "/home/learn-how-to-prevent-the-flu/", "owner": 2, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T23:27:49.051Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-02-20T23:27:49Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-20T23:42:34.820Z", "topic": 14, "toplink": false, "description": "We provide free flu shots to people who are uninsured or on Medicaid.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "We provide free flu shots to people who are uninsured or on Medicaid.", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

What is the flu?

Influenza, known as \u201cthe flu,\u201d is a contagious disease that affects the nose, throat, and lungs. Common symptoms are fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, head and body ache, and fatigue.

While many people have mild cases of the flu, some cases can result in hospitalization or even death. Some people are more at risk of developing serious flu-related complications:

  • Kids under the age of five
  • Adults over 65
  • Pregnant women
  • People with chronic medical conditions (like asthma, diabetes, or heart disease)

The flu in Austin

People are most likely to get the flu from October through March.

From October to June, we provide free flu shots to uninsured kids and adults, and to people on Medicaid.

How to prevent the flu

The best way to prevent the flu is by getting a flu shot every year. By keeping your flu shots up-to-date, you\u2019ll protect yourself and help prevent at-risk groups from getting sick.

You can be contagious one day before and up to a week after becoming sick. Following good hygiene practices can prevent the spread of the flu.

  • Stay at home if you\u2019re feeling sick.
  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
  • When you cough, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve.
  • Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on the flu

Related news

Travis County Influenza Report, February 1, 2019. Cases of the flu increased in Travis County during the early part of 2019.

{"pk": 33, "path": "00010001000R", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Learn about measles in Austin", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Learn about measles in Austin", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": " Learn about measles in Austin ", "slug": "learn-about-measles-in-austin", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "learn-about-measles-in-austin", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_ar": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_en": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_es": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_vi": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "owner": 2, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T23:43:18.800Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-02-20T23:43:18.755Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-20T23:49:43.352Z", "topic": 14, "toplink": false, "description": "Immunizations are the only way to prevent measles.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Immunizations are the only way to prevent measles.", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

What is measles?

Measles is a contagious disease that spreads through the air. It is so contagious that if a person has it, 9 out of 10 unvaccinated people around that person will become infected.

At first, people with measles seem to have a cold, with symptoms such as a high fever, runny nose, cough, and sore throat. After two to four days, a spotty red rash appears. The rash appears on the head and face, then spreads to the rest of the body.

Some people are more at risk of developing serious measles-related complications:

  • Kids under the age of five
  • Adults over 20
  • Pregnant women

Severe cases can result in hospitalization or even death. If you\u2019re pregnant, measles can cause complications such as early labor and low birth weight.

Measles in Austin

The measles virus can cause a serious health problem in the community. If you think someone might have measles, contact 3-1-1 or your healthcare professional. Only healthcare professionals should notify the Epidemiology and Health Statistics Unit at (512) 972-5555.

Kids without insurance or who are on Medicaid can get low-cost or free immunizations from the City of Austin. Call (512) 972-5520 to learn more.

How to prevent measles

  • Most importantly, make sure your and your kids\u2019 immunizations are up-to-date.
  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water or use hand sanitizer.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
  • When you cough or sneeze, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve.
  • Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
  • Stay home if you are sick.

People who might have measles should visit a healthcare professional as soon as possible and not go to school or work.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on measles

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-20T23:23:41.542Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T23:23:41.442Z", "live_revision": 180, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-21T18:27:44.133Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_es": "Proceso de Investigaci\u00f3n de Quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.853Z", "live_revision": 172, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-21T19:03:37.501Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

  1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

  1. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

  1. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias. La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.AceptadaLa evidencia apoya el alegato.ExoneradaLa evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.InfundadaLa evidencia no apoya el alegato.InconclusaLa evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).Cerrada administrativamenteTodos los siguientes aplican:(a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.(b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.(c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado.Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

What we do

We provide residential curbside collection of trash, recycling, compost, yard trimmings, bulk items, and large brush. Additional services include sweeping streets, collecting dead animals and operating a drop-off center for recycling and household hazardous waste.

We are committed to a Zero Waste goal to reduce the amount of trash sent to landfills by 90 percent by the year 2040. Zero Waste is a philosophy that goes beyond recycling to focus first on reducing trash and reusing products and then recycling and composting the rest. Zero Waste recognizes that one person\u2019s trash is another person\u2019s treasure, and everything is a resource for something or someone else.

", "what_we_do_ar": "
