{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_es": "Proceso de Investigaci\u00f3n de Quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-21T19:03:37.586Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-21T19:03:37.503Z", "live_revision": 194, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-22T22:24:42.927Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed: All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee. This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_es": "

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

  1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

  1. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima.   1. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

  1. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un traductor si solicita uno.[Link or embed button to complaint form]

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Esto es lo que debe esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Esto es lo que debe esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Esto es lo que debe esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-21T19:03:37.586Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-22T22:43:14.150Z", "live_revision": 194, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-22T22:43:58.812Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

After you file a complaint, it will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA) and overseen by OPO.

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": "Oficina de Fiscalización de la Policía", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-25T22:10:45.463Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-25T22:10:45.381Z", "live_revision": 211, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-26T00:17:25.682Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.  
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.   

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.  
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": "Oficina de Fiscalización de la Policía", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-25T22:10:45.463Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-26T00:17:25.684Z", "live_revision": 211, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-26T00:17:37.140Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD).We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint Investigation Process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-25T22:31:36.407Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-25T22:31:36.322Z", "live_revision": 212, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T00:49:23.479Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Lo que se puede esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint investigation process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint investigation process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint Investigation Process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T00:49:23.687Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T00:49:23.481Z", "live_revision": 216, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T03:13:40.031Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee.This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension.We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Lo que se puede esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n.Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": "Oficina de Fiscalización de la Policía", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-26T23:51:47.955Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-26T23:51:47.792Z", "live_revision": 215, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T03:14:43.760Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties -- residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) -- as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "
