", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": "Oficina de Fiscalización de la Policía", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T03:14:44.020Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T03:20:37.662Z", "live_revision": 218, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T03:22:30.191Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties — residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) — as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint investigation process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint investigation process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint investigation process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T03:13:40.201Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T03:13:40.032Z", "live_revision": 217, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T03:30:59.103Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee. This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension. We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Lo que se puede esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n. Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

", "additional_content_vi": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties — residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) — as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties — residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) — as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de \u00e9tica de un polic\u00eda, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties \u2014 residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) \u2014 as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

{"pk": 28, "path": "00010001000M", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "How we store and use your data", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "How we store and use your data", "title_es": "C\u00f3mo almacenamos y usamos su informaci\u00f3n", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "How we store and use your data", "slug": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_ar": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_en": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_es": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_vi": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:50:25.097Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:50:25.097Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T22:50:25.025Z", "live_revision": 169, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:48:29.147Z", "updated_at": "2019-02-27T06:12:43.132Z", "topic": 18, "toplink": false, "description": "", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly.

", "additional_content_es": "

Cuando usted presenta una queja contra un oficial del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin, cualquier informaci\u00f3n que comparta ser\u00e1 confidencial, al menos y hasta que algo lo haga p\u00fablico. Esto puede incluir el hecho de que el caso pase a un tribunal criminal, lo que significa que puede estar sujeto a descubrimiento de pruebas. En esos casos, redactamos cualquier informaci\u00f3n de contacto que fue suministrada, pero no los nombres.

Su queja se le env\u00eda por correo electr\u00f3nico autom\u00e1ticamente a usted y a la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda y se almacena en un servidor de Microsoft Exchange. Luego el personal en la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda la revisa, la introduce manualmente a la base de datos que se comparte con Asuntos Internos, una divisi\u00f3n del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Para prop\u00f3sitos de reporte y an\u00e1lisis de tendencias, introducimos las quejas de manera an\u00f3nima en una base de datos Sharepoint por separado.

Tambi\u00e9n utilizamos su informaci\u00f3n para encontrar tendencias y patrones en las quejas y agradecimientos, y de esta manera proponemos recomendaciones para las pol\u00edticas y entrenamientos del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Usted puede ver los reportes y recomendaciones anteriores aqu\u00ed. [link when available]

", "additional_content_vi": "

", "image": null, "contacts": [{"pk": 1, "page": 28, "contact": 2}]}

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin\u2019s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation\u2019s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties \u2014 residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) \u2014 as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de \u00e9tica de un polic\u00eda, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea m\u00e1s f\u00e1cil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer informaci\u00f3n y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea m\u00e1s f\u00e1cil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer informaci\u00f3n sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electr\u00f3nico, formulario en l\u00ednea, tel\u00e9fono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer an\u00f3nimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusi\u00f3n y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigaci\u00f3n.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, c\u00f3mo lo hacemos y c\u00f3mo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina tambi\u00e9n:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque alg\u00fan residente espec\u00edfico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, as\u00ed como recomendaciones para pol\u00edticas m\u00e1s amplias.
  • Est\u00e1 comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociaci\u00f3n de Polic\u00edas de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversaci\u00f3n continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 4, "path": "000100010001", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Get a birth or death certificate", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Get a birth or death certificate", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Get a birth or death certificate", "slug": "birth-and-death-certificates", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "birth-and-death-certificates", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 4, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/birth-and-death-certificates/", "url_path_ar": null, "url_path_en": "/home/birth-and-death-certificates/", "url_path_es": null, "url_path_vi": null, "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2018-09-25T20:08:47.039Z", "last_published_at": "2018-10-25T13:35:54.901Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2018-10-25T13:35:54.480Z", "live_revision": 98, "created_at": "2018-09-25T20:08:46.785Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-15T15:59:22.139Z", "topic": 13, "steps": "[{\"type\": \"step_with_options_accordian\", \"value\": {\"options_description\": \"Determine how you would like to receive your certificate based on how quickly you need it\", \"options\": [{\"option_name\": \"15 minutes in person\", \"option_description\": \"
  1. Bring your current, government-issued photo identification.
  2. Bring cash, a money order in the exact amount, a personal check, or a credit or debit card in your name for the certificate you need.
  3. Visit the The Office of Vital Records is at 7201 Levander Loop, Building C, Austin, TX, 78702 between 8 am and 4:30 pm Monday through Friday. The last application is accepted until 4:15 p.m. Note that our office is usually busiest between 11:00 a.m. \\u2013 2:00 p.m. Customers should expect longer wait times during those hours.
  4. For faster service, download and print an application in English or Spanish and bring it with you.
\"}, {\"option_name\": \"2-5 business days online\", \"option_description\": \"
  1. Visit www.VitalChek.com.
  2. Follow the prompts on VitalChek to select which kind of certificate(s) you need.
  3. Verify your identity by answering the questions on VitalChek. If they cannot verify your identity with their standard questions, you will be instructed to upload a copy of your current government-issued identification and proof of shipping address before your application can be processed. This will delay the processing and delivery time.
  4. Use a credit or debit card (Visa, MasterCard, American Express, or Discover) to pay for your certificate(s). Processing and UPS shipping fees will be added.
\"}, {\"option_name\": \"3-5 business days by phone\", \"option_description\": \"
  1. Call VitalChek, our secure online agent at 1-800-457-7586.
  2. Verify your identity by answering a series of questions. If VitalChek cannot verify your identity with their standard questions, you will be instructed to upload a copy of your current government-issued identification and proof of shipping address before your application can be processed. This will delay the processing and delivery time.
  3. Use a credit or debit card (Visa, MasterCard, American Express, or Discover) to pay for your certificate(s). Processing and UPS shipping fees will be added.
\"}, {\"option_name\": \"2-3 weeks by mail\", \"option_description\": \"

Mail the following items to Office of Vital Records, PO Box 1088, Austin, TX 78767-1088:

  1. A completed and notarized certificate application in English or a certificate application in Spanish.
  2. A check or money order in the exact amount payable to the Office of Vital Records. Personal checks must be signed by the same person who signs the application
  3. A copy of one of your acceptable and current forms of government-issued photo identification. If your home address is different than the address on your ID, also include a proof of residence like a utility bill, voter registration card, etc...
  4. A self-addressed envelope with a stamp. You may use an express mail envelope for faster return delivery. If this is not included, you will not receive the certificate.

If you need the certificate quickly through the mail, use an Express form of delivery, such as FedEx, USPS, or UPS, and send your application to: Office of Vital Records, 7201 Levander Loop, Bldg. C, Austin, TX 78702.

\"}]}, \"id\": \"f601e59c-9e52-46f3-947e-399120fa604a\"}]", "dynamic_content": "[]", "additional_content": "

Make sure you have enough money for the certificate(s) you need.

  • The cost for each birth certificate is $23.
  • The cost for one death certificate is $21.
  • If you order more copies at the same time, the cost for each extra one is $4.

{"pk": 37, "path": "00010001000V", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Privacy policy for Alpha.Austin.gov", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Privacy policy for Alpha.Austin.gov", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Privacy policy for Alpha.Austin.gov", "slug": "privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov/", "url_path_ar": "/home/privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov/", "url_path_en": "/home/privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov/", "url_path_es": "/home/privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov/", "url_path_vi": "/home/privacy-policy-for-alphaaustingov/", "owner": 2, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-03-15T20:06:23.896Z", "live_revision": null, "created_at": "2019-03-15T20:06:23.813Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-15T20:11:09.059Z", "topic": 28, "toplink": false, "description": "", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Privacy policy

This policy is to inform visitors to the Alpha.austin.gov web site of its data gathering methods and use of such data. Alpha.Austin.gov collects many types of data throughout its web site and the degree to which this data is used will be specified below. The City of Austin may change this policy at any time at its sole discretion and without notice.

HIPPA privacy practices

The Public Health Department will comply with all federal and state laws that pertain to any aspect of the clinical practices or business procedures of the Department. In particular, privacy and security rules relating to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), along with related state laws, are integral to matters of privacy, medical records, and the confidentiality of communications. For more information, see the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services website on Health Information Privacy.

Logs and activity reports

The Alpha.austin.gov web site collects data each time a visitor enters the Alpha.austin.gov web site or moves from one page to the next within the web site. This information is used to gather statistics about visitors as a whole and in no way points to individuals. Personal information is not gathered in the Alpha.austin.gov web site log files. The information gathered falls into these categories:

  • Time of day
  • Date
  • Which URL was visited prior to coming to the Alpha.austin.gov web site
  • Which URL you are viewing at the Alpha.austin.gov web site
  • What browser and version of browser you use
  • Which Operating System you use

The above information is processed and analyzed to keep the Alpha.austin.gov web site up to industry standards. Portions of the website's design and functionality are influenced by the data collected.

Collection and use of information

The Alpha.austin.gov web site does not sell or lease personal information. Information submitted to the Alpha.austin.gov web site may be subject to the Texas Public Information Act. Information about the Texas Public Information Act is available from the Office of the Texas Attorney General at http://www.oag.state.tx.us/open/requestors.shtml.

For more information regarding specific City of Austin Connection web pages or web applications, contact the City of Austin\u2019s Communications and Public Information Office at webadmin@austintexas.gov or 512-974-3329.

Often personal or business information is requested by an Alpha.austin.gov web site online service. The request of information, storage of that information and the dissemination of that information will vary based on the department and/or service.

In each instance, clear indications of whether or not the information is required or optional will be marked.

The Alpha.austin.gov web site may be required by law enforcement or judicial authorities to provide personally identifiable information to the appropriate governmental authorities. We reserve the right to report to law enforcement agencies any activities that we in good faith believe to be unlawful.

Security

This site uses a secure server for conducting online services. All credit card and other payment information that you transmit to us will be protected by industry standard encryption; provided your browser is properly configured and your computer is operating properly. Current browsers provide visual cues to the visitor that the online service is secure. In the bottom of the browser you should see a key or lock. If the key is not broken or the lock is locked, then you are on a secure site. If not the site is not secure, you should not trust the transmission of personal information to the site.

Personal information is secured and only those employees that monitor the status of the computers, or perform routine maintenance are allowed access. For more information regarding the security of personal or business information, you can contact the Communications and Technology Management Department.

Cookies

Cookies are small text files that are stored on the visitor's hard drive in order to place certain information regarding the transaction. A session ID, along with time date and other information may be gathered. In order for the transaction to take place, cookies must be enabled by your browser.

The Alpha.austin.gov Web site uses cookies in some of its online services.

{"pk": 33, "path": "00010001000R", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Prevent measles in Austin", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Prevent measles in Austin", "title_es": null, "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Learn about measles in Austin", "slug": "learn-about-measles-in-austin", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "learn-about-measles-in-austin", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_ar": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_en": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_es": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "url_path_vi": "/home/learn-about-measles-in-austin/", "owner": 2, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T23:49:43.421Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-20T23:49:43.421Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-20T23:49:43.353Z", "live_revision": 185, "created_at": "2019-02-20T23:43:18.755Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-19T12:58:43.289Z", "topic": 14, "toplink": false, "description": "Immunizations are the only way to prevent measles.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Immunizations are the only way to prevent measles.", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

What is measles?

Measles is a contagious disease that spreads through the air. It is so contagious that if a person has it, 9 out of 10 unvaccinated people around that person will become infected.

At first, people with measles seem to have a cold, with symptoms such as a high fever, runny nose, cough, and sore throat. After two to four days, a spotty red rash appears. The rash appears on the head and face, then spreads to the rest of the body.

Some people are more at risk of developing serious measles-related complications:

  • Kids under the age of five
  • Adults over 20
  • Pregnant women

Severe cases can result in hospitalization or even death. If you\u2019re pregnant, measles can cause complications such as early labor and low birth weight.

Measles in Austin

The measles virus can cause a serious health problem in the community. If you think someone might have measles, contact 3-1-1 or your healthcare professional. Only healthcare professionals should notify the Epidemiology and Health Statistics Unit at (512) 972-5555.

Kids without insurance or who are on Medicaid can get low-cost or free immunizations from the City of Austin. Call (512) 972-5520 to learn more.

How to prevent measles

  • Most importantly, make sure your and your kids\u2019 immunizations are up-to-date.
  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water or use hand sanitizer.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
  • When you cough or sneeze, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve.
  • Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
  • Stay home if you are sick.

People who might have measles should visit a healthcare professional as soon as possible and not go to school or work.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on measles

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

What is measles?

Measles is a contagious disease that spreads through the air. It is so contagious that if a person has it, 9 out of 10 unvaccinated people around that person will become infected.

At first, people with measles seem to have a cold, with symptoms such as a high fever, runny nose, cough, and sore throat. After two to four days, a spotty red rash appears. The rash appears on the head and face, then spreads to the rest of the body.

Some people are more at risk of developing serious measles-related complications:

  • Kids under the age of five
  • Adults over 20
  • Pregnant women

Severe cases can result in hospitalization or even death. If you\u2019re pregnant, measles can cause complications such as early labor and low birth weight.

Measles in Austin

The measles virus can cause a serious health problem in the community. If you think someone might have measles, contact 3-1-1 or your healthcare professional. Only healthcare professionals should notify the Epidemiology and Health Statistics Unit at (512) 972-5555.

Kids without insurance or who are on Medicaid can get low-cost or free immunizations from the City of Austin. Call (512) 972-5520 to learn more.

How to prevent measles

  • Most importantly, make sure your and your kids\u2019 immunizations are up-to-date.
  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water or use hand sanitizer.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
  • When you cough or sneeze, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve.
  • Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
  • Stay home if you are sick.

People who might have measles should visit a healthcare professional as soon as possible and not go to school or work.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on measles

What is the flu?

Influenza, known as \u201cthe flu,\u201d is a contagious disease that affects the nose, throat, and lungs. Common symptoms are fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, head and body ache, and fatigue.

While many people have mild cases of the flu, some cases can result in hospitalization or even death. Some people are more at risk of developing serious flu-related complications:

  • Kids under the age of five
  • Adults over 65
  • Pregnant women
  • People with chronic medical conditions (like asthma, diabetes, or heart disease)

The flu in Austin

People are most likely to get the flu from October through March.

From October to June, we provide free flu shots to uninsured kids and adults, and to people on Medicaid.

How to prevent the flu

The best way to prevent the flu is by getting a flu shot every year. By keeping your flu shots up-to-date, you\u2019ll protect yourself and help prevent at-risk groups from getting sick.

You can be contagious one day before and up to a week after becoming sick. Following good hygiene practices can prevent the spread of the flu.

  • Stay at home if you\u2019re feeling sick.
  • Wash your hands regularly with soap and water.
  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
  • When you cough, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve.
  • Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

Learn more

Centers for Disease Control on the flu

Related news

Travis County Influenza Report, February 1, 2019. Cases of the flu increased in Travis County during the early part of 2019.

{"pk": 27, "path": "00010001000L", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Office of Police Oversight", "title_es": "Oficina de Fiscalización de la Policía", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Office of Police Oversight", "slug": "police-oversight", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "police-oversight", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 48, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_ar": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_en": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_es": "/home/police-oversight/", "url_path_vi": "/home/police-oversight/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:47:37.903Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T14:41:06.021Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T14:41:05.893Z", "live_revision": 233, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:45:45.614Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-19T20:43:11.891Z", "what_we_do": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties — residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) — as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_ar": "

", "what_we_do_en": "

When people have concerns or complaints about potential police misconduct, those concerns need to be heard, investigated, and resolved. At Austin’s Office of Police Oversight (OPO), everything we do is to promote an atmosphere of earned trust between Austinites and the Austin Police Department (APD). We do this by making it easy, accessible, and safe for Austinites to provide information and start the process. For example, we ensure that:

  • There are several reporting options available (email, an online form, telephone, etc.).
  • The process is not overwhelming or complex.
  • People understand that they can choose to remain anonymous.
  • There is follow-through and transparency on the investigation’s status and eventual outcome.
  • The community understands what we do, how we do it, and how to reach us.

Our office also:

  • Can start its own complaints independent of specific residents making a complaint.
  • Makes recommendations to the City Manager and to APD about individual incidents and investigations, as well as broader policy recommendations.
  • Is committed to treating all parties — residents, APD, and the Austin Police Association (APA) — as stakeholders involved in an ongoing conversation. We seek to understand and learn from all perspectives.
", "what_we_do_es": "

Cuando las personas tienen preocupaciones o quejas sobre una posible falta de ética de un policía, esas preocupaciones deben ser escuchadas, investigadas y resueltas.

Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información y comenzar el proceso. Logramos hacer esto haciendo que sea más fácil, accesible y seguro para los residentes de Austin proveer información sobre sus interacciones con el Departamento de Policía de Austin. Por ejemplo, nos aseguramos de que:

  • Haya varias opciones de reportes disponibles (correo electrónico, formulario en línea, teléfono, etc.).
  • El proceso no sea abrumador ni complejo.
  • Las personas entiendan que pueden decidir permanecer anónimas.
  • El proceso se lleve a una conclusión y haya transparencia sobre el estado y posible resultado de la investigación.
  • La comunidad comprenda lo que hacemos, cómo lo hacemos y cómo se pueden comunicar con nosotros.

Nuestra oficina también:

  • Puede comenzar sus propias quejas aunque algún residente específico no presente una queja.
  • Presenta recomendaciones al Administrador Municipal y a APD sobre incidentes e investigaciones individuales, así como recomendaciones para políticas más amplias.
  • Está comprometida a tratar todas las partes, residentes, APD y la Asociación de Policías de Austin (APA), como partes interesadas en una conversación continua. Una de nuestras metas es comprender y aprender de todas las perspectivas.
", "what_we_do_vi": "

{"pk": 28, "path": "00010001000M", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "How we store and use your data", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "How we store and use your data", "title_es": "C\u00f3mo almacenamos y usamos su informaci\u00f3n", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "How we store and use your data", "slug": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "how-we-store-and-use-your-data", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_ar": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_en": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_es": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "url_path_vi": "/home/how-we-store-and-use-your-data/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:50:25.097Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T06:14:03.128Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T06:14:03.022Z", "live_revision": 228, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:48:29.147Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-20T04:06:48.328Z", "topic": null, "department": 27, "toplink": false, "description": "", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "", "description_es": "", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly.

", "additional_content_es": "

Cuando usted presenta una queja contra un oficial del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin, cualquier informaci\u00f3n que comparta ser\u00e1 confidencial, al menos y hasta que algo lo haga p\u00fablico. Esto puede incluir el hecho de que el caso pase a un tribunal criminal, lo que significa que puede estar sujeto a descubrimiento de pruebas. En esos casos, redactamos cualquier informaci\u00f3n de contacto que fue suministrada, pero no los nombres.

Su queja se le env\u00eda por correo electr\u00f3nico autom\u00e1ticamente a usted y a la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda y se almacena en un servidor de Microsoft Exchange. Luego el personal en la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda la revisa, la introduce manualmente a la base de datos que se comparte con Asuntos Internos, una divisi\u00f3n del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin. Para prop\u00f3sitos de reporte y an\u00e1lisis de tendencias, introducimos las quejas de manera an\u00f3nima en una base de datos Sharepoint por separado.

Tambi\u00e9n utilizamos su informaci\u00f3n para encontrar tendencias y patrones en las quejas y agradecimientos, y de esta manera proponemos recomendaciones para las pol\u00edticas y entrenamientos del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin.

When you file a complaint against an Austin Police Department officer, any information you share will be kept confidential, unless and until an event causes it to be made public. This could include the case going to criminal court, which means it could be subject to discovery. In such cases, we redact any contact information if it was provided, but not the names.

Your complaint is automatically emailed to you and the Office of Police Oversight and stored on a Microsoft Exchange server. It is then reviewed by a staff person in the Office of Police Oversight, then manually entered into a database shared with Internal Affairs, a division of the Austin Police Department. For purposes of trend reporting and analysis, we enter non-anonymous complaints into a separate Sharepoint database.

We also use your data to find trends and patterns in complaints and thank yous, and make policy and training recommendations to the Austin Police Department accordingly.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

Para prop\u00f3sitos de reporte y an\u00e1lisis de tendencias, introducimos las quejas de manera an\u00f3nima en una base de datos Sharepoint por separado.

Tambi\u00e9n utilizamos su informaci\u00f3n para encontrar tendencias y patrones en las quejas y agradecimientos, y de esta manera proponemos recomendaciones para las pol\u00edticas y entrenamientos del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin.

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint investigation process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint investigation process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint investigation process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-02-27T03:30:59.425Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-02-27T03:30:59.105Z", "live_revision": 221, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-20T04:07:26.874Z", "topic": null, "department": 27, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee. This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension. We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "

", "additional_content_en": "

  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.

  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee. This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension. ", "additional_content_es": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Lo que se puede esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n. Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

", "additional_content_vi": "

Los especialistas en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda (OPO, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s) revisan independientemente cualquier queja y siguen el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n que se describe aqu\u00ed. Las quejas se investigan formalmente cuando muestran una posible violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas del Departamento de Polic\u00eda de Austin (APD, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

Lo que se puede esperar

Periodo de tiempo

Las investigaciones pueden tomar hasta seis meses y de una a cuatro horas de su tiempo durante el transcurso de esos meses. Nuestra oficina se pondr\u00e1 en contacto con usted con una actualizaci\u00f3n mensual. Al final, tendr\u00e1 la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar en detalle sobre el resultado de su queja.

Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n

Cuando usted presenta una queja, un sargento en Asuntos Internos la investigar\u00e1 y OPO la fiscalizar\u00e1.

1. La OPO recibe su queja.

Un especialista en quejas de OPO revisa la queja, incluyendo cualquier video, audio y otra evidencia disponible. Luego enviamos la informaci\u00f3n a Asuntos Internos (IA, por sus siglas en ingl\u00e9s).

2. IA comienza una investigaci\u00f3n con OPO.

IA revisa la queja y la clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

Las quejas Clase A incluyen, entre otras:

  • Conducta criminal
  • Violaciones graves a las pol\u00edticas
  • Conducta que puede perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda

Las quejas Clase B incluyen, entre otras:

  • Violaciones a las pol\u00edticas como obscenidades, menosprecio, servicio policial inadecuado o infracciones de tr\u00e1nsito menores
  • Da\u00f1o negligente o p\u00e9rdida de propiedad
  • Choques negligentes

Las quejas Clase C no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas, sino que el oficial quiz\u00e1s necesite entrenamiento para manejar mejor la situaci\u00f3n.

Las quejas Clase D no son violaciones a las pol\u00edticas porque la evidencia demuestra que son falsas.

  • Las Investigaciones Administrativas las pueden solicitar el Jefe o su designado, generalmente por asuntos que podr\u00edan perjudicar al Departamento de Polic\u00eda.
  • Las Derivaciones al Supervisor se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja solicita hablar con un supervisor.
  • Las Preocupaciones de los Ciudadanos se utilizan cuando la persona que presenta la queja se comunica con OPO con una preocupaci\u00f3n, generalmente an\u00f3nima. OPO luego se la env\u00eda a IA para que la investigue y clasifique, si es necesario.

Si usted nos dio su informaci\u00f3n de contacto y solicit\u00f3 que nos comunic\u00e1ramos con usted, un empleado de OPO le contactar\u00e1 en un periodo de dos a cuatro d\u00edas laborales.

3. Si es necesario, el Jefe de Polic\u00eda determina el resultado, que pudiera incluir acciones disciplinarias.

La naturaleza de su queja determinar\u00e1 si ocurre un cambio a la pol\u00edtica o acciones disciplinarias.

La decisi\u00f3n se clasifica de acuerdo con las pol\u00edticas y el manual del empleado de APD.

  • Aceptada: La evidencia apoya el alegato.
  • Exonerada: La evidencia apoya el alegato, pero no hubo violaci\u00f3n a las pol\u00edticas.
  • Infundada: La evidencia no apoya el alegato.
  • Inconclusa: La evidencia no es suficiente para apoyar el alegato ni exonerar al oficial(es).
  • Cerrada administrativamente: Todos los siguientes aplican:
    • (a) No hubo alegatos o no hubo una falta.
    • (b) Se clasific\u00f3 como una queja Clase C o Clase D.
    • (c) A discreci\u00f3n del Jefe o su designado. Esta categor\u00eda tambi\u00e9n se usa cuando el oficial se jubila o renuncia durante la investigaci\u00f3n.

4. Le notificamos el resultado.

Le notificamos el resultado por correo electr\u00f3nico o correo postal. Si el oficial en cuesti\u00f3n recibi\u00f3 una suspensi\u00f3n de un d\u00eda o m\u00e1s como consecuencia de su queja, incluiremos su memorando disciplinario que describe las circunstancias de la suspensi\u00f3n. Le ofreceremos la opci\u00f3n de una reuni\u00f3n de cierre para hablar sobre el resultado con el director y un especialista en quejas de la Oficina de Fiscalizaci\u00f3n de la Polic\u00eda, as\u00ed como un int\u00e9rprete si solicita uno.

", "additional_content_vi": "

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000N", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Complaint investigation process", "title_ar": null, "title_en": "Complaint investigation process", "title_es": "Proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas", "title_vi": null, "draft_title": "Complaint investigation process", "slug": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_ar": null, "slug_en": "complaint-investigation-process", "slug_es": null, "slug_vi": null, "content_type": 46, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_ar": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_en": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_es": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "url_path_vi": "/home/complaint-investigation-process/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "seo_title_ar": null, "seo_title_en": null, "seo_title_es": null, "seo_title_vi": null, "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "search_description_ar": "", "search_description_en": "", "search_description_es": "", "search_description_vi": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2019-02-20T22:54:30.919Z", "last_published_at": "2019-03-20T04:07:32.467Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2019-03-20T04:07:32.387Z", "live_revision": 246, "created_at": "2019-02-20T22:51:33.512Z", "updated_at": "2019-03-20T08:25:27.831Z", "topic": null, "department": 27, "toplink": true, "description": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_ar": "", "description_en": "Learn about the OPO's complaint investigation process.", "description_es": "Aprenda sobre el proceso de investigaci\u00f3n de quejas de OPO.", "description_vi": "", "options": "[]", "options_ar": "[]", "options_en": "[]", "options_es": "[]", "options_vi": "[]", "additional_content": "

Complaint specialists in the Office of Police Oversight (OPO) independently review every complaint and follow the investigation process described here. Complaints are formally investigated when they show a potential violation of Austin Police Department (APD) policies.

Here\u2019s what to expect

Timeframe

Investigations could take up to six months to complete and may require one to four hours of your time over the course of those months. Our office will contact you with an update monthly. At the end, you will have the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome of your complaint in detail.

Investigation Process

Your complaint will be investigated by a sergeant in Internal Affairs (IA), a division of the Austin Police Department (APD), and overseen by the Office of Police Oversight (OPO).

1. The OPO receives your complaint.

A complaint specialist in the OPO reviews your complaint, including any available video, audio, or other evidence. Then we send the information to IA.

2. IA begins an investigation with the OPO.

IA reviews the complaint and classifies it according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

Class A complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Criminal conduct
  • Serious policy violations
  • Conduct that could damage the Police Department

Class B complaints include, but are not limited to:

  • Policy violations such as profanity, belittling language, inadequate police service, or minor traffic violations
  • Negligent damage or loss of property
  • Negligent crashes

Class C complaints are not policy violations, but the officer might need training to handle the situation better.

Class D complaints are not policy violations because the evidence shows they are false.

  • Administrative Inquiries are ordered by the Chief or their designee, generally for issues that could damage the Police Department.
  • Supervisor Referrals are used when the complainant requests to speak with a supervisor.
  • Citizen Concerns are used when a complainant contacts OPO with a concern, often anonymously. OPO then sends it to IA for investigation and further classification, if deemed necessary.

If you provided your contact information and requested we follow up with you, a staff person with the OPO will contact you within two to four business days.

3. If necessary, the Chief of Police determines the outcome, which may include disciplinary action.

The nature of your complaint will determine if any policy change or disciplinary action occurs.

The decision is categorized according to APD\u2019s policy and employee manual.

  • Sustained: The evidence supports the allegation.
  • Exonerated: The evidence supports the allegation, but it was not a policy violation.
  • Unfounded: The evidence does not support the allegation.
  • Inconclusive: The evidence isn\u2019t enough to either support the allegation or exonerate the officer(s).
  • Administratively Closed:
    • All of the following are true:
    • (a) There were no allegations or there was no misconduct.
    • (b) It was classified as a Class C or Class D complaint.
    • (c) At the discretion of the Chief or their designee. This category is also used when the officer(s) retired or resigned during the investigation.

4. We notify you of the outcome.

We notify you of the outcome via email or mail. If the officer in question received a suspension of one day or more as a consequence of your complaint, we will include their disciplinary memo describing the circumstances of their suspension. We will also offer you the option of a close-out meeting to discuss the outcome with the director and a complaint specialist from the Office of Police Oversight, as well as an interpreter if you requested one.

", "additional_content_ar": "
